oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: bag of soil
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This is a small fabric bag in the colors of the French and American flags. It contains a small sample of soil from France. It was given to a Gold Star Mother by the French as a token of appreciation for the sacrifice of her son in the defence of France. It belonged to Sarah Frances M. Ring of Franklin, Tennessee. Her son, Pvt. Frank M. Ring, Co. A, 114th MG Battn., 30th Div. was killed in October 1918. He was buried in one of the American cemteries in France.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
